dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just dark, but blustery too -- a snowstorm has kicked We see the headlights of an approaching MINIVAN. And HEAR

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS GRIMM, (VO)
dialogues.text: We've been talking about it for years. White sandy beaches, palm trees, warm tropical breezes --

dialogues.speaker: BOY'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Did something happen at work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The “BOY” is JOHN GRIMM, 16, in back with his 18-year-old sister, SAMANTHA. John is an athletic live-wire and affab wise-ass. Sam is bright, academic, and dubious.

dialogues.speaker: MARY GRIMM
dialogues.text: I thought you’d both be delighted to get above ground. Enjoy a little sunshine, get away from school. In front, the parents: MARY and LOUIS GRIMM, two brillian scientists, 40’s. Tension and fatigue etched on their fac

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Is something wrong with the “Ark”? The adults don’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Was there a problem on Olduvai? A pair of HEADLIGHTS appears in the rearview mirror, lig up the van’s interior --

dialogues.speaker: MARY GRIMM
dialogues.text: Look, it’s been very busy, there’s a lot going on with the company.

dialogues.speaker: LOUIS GRIMM
dialogues.text: ..-It’s complicated. Distracted, Louis doesn’t notice the other vehicle is now tailgating or else its lost traction, control. LOUIS GRIMM (cont'd) We'll have a family meeting to talk about it when we get there, okay -- John’s gaze flicks to the rearview mirror for a beat and then: the WORLD EXPLODES in a STORM of GLASS and METAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Struck from behind by the PICK-UP TRUCK, the van collapse like an accordion as it pinwheels toward the bridge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John’s head SMASHES against his window: blood spatters gl The minivan comes to a VIOLENT STOP. Mary flies forward, mashing her face and forearm against the dashboard. Sam's ribs audibly SNAP under the pressure of her seatbel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van’s spun halfway across, halting only when it hits support column, hangs precariously over the edge and then silence for a long moment. No one moves, until finally -- LOUIS GRIMM’S VOICE (groans, dazed) No... Sam... John...? Mary moans, insensate. Her nasal cartilage crushed. Louis tries to find his bearings, can’t quite focus when -- Sam’s door is yanked open and someone pulls her from the Forcing the van to lurch horribly forward. It tilts, tee totters for a moment suspended in time. Then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John opens his eyes, trying to focus. Where are they? Watches as a single SNOWFLAKE strikes the windshield. And the van plunges into the dark river below!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John desperately fumbles his seatbelt to free himself as water rushes up. Louis escapes his, begins work on Mary's John's seatbelt releases. He kicks wildly at the window t was already spider-webbed by his bloody head. No luck. Louis frees Mary but she doesn’t react: she’s concussed, glassy, unfocused. The middle of her face a purplish pulp John swims. about. Then a hand on his shoulder: his fathe hand. Louis pushes John’s face into a tiny air bubble. Jo purses his lips, takes a breath, tries to submerge himsel To save his dad, instead of him! But Louis is stronger. John’s father remains below him, raising him up so he can inhale the last gasp of air in the sinking vehicle. John struggles against Louis -- wanting more than anythin sacrifice himself ... but his diminishing vigor fails him John inhales the last available breath from the bubble as father’s limp hands fall away into the darkness below as cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: POUNDING FOOTSTEPS, HEAVY BREATHING AS --
dialogues.text: “Ten Years Later” Appears, then disappears as WE FIND OURSELVES in a darken

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a vast underground lab somewhere. Narrow lead-li dank tunnels, dim lights, and now from around a corner co DR. TODD CARMACK -- terrified, sprinting faster than any year-old. Three more SCIENTISTS in smudged, torn LAB COAT Darkness at their heels. They also run with unnatural spe Carmack leads, heading for a heavy door at the end of th hall lit by a single flickering bulb. Two others are righ behind. One Scientist trails, clutching his gut: a cramp. The instant he slows, his body is jerked sideways into th shadows by a force unseen. And then there were three. The footrace with Death resumes. The doorway to deliveran a hundred yards away. Carmack pulling ahead of the pack. The Scientist now in the rear is steadily losing ground; tries desperately to speed up. He pumps his arms furiousl and when he’s jerked into darkness by those arms, the sou of a WET CRUNCH suggests they were torn from their socket Carmack reaches the door. Paws at the control panel. The door slides open. His last surviving colleague trailing .

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE SCIENTIST
dialogues.text: Dr. Carmack, please!! INT. CARMACK’S OFFICE - CONTINUOUS Carmack squeezes through the narrow opening, punches at t interior control panel. The steel door reverses direction

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE SCIENTIST, (0S)
dialogues.text: Dr. Carmack!! Her arm shoots through the crack between door and wall. T with a thick CLANK and even thicker CRUNCH, the door SHUT Carmack takes a step back, watching in horror as his form coworker’s fingers spasm. The digits turn blue, then go still, and Carmack exhales deeply -- revolted but relieve Then the whole arm rockets upward, SMACKING into the ceil with immense force. It then flies down, SLAPPING the floo Carmack stumbles back, transfixed as the arm is wrenched and down. The brief but fierce struggle abruptly ends as arm drops to the floor. Carmack whirls, to the vid-phone.

dialogues.speaker: CARMACK
dialogues.text: This is Classified Research, Olduvai! Request immediate instructions to override protocol -- The rest is drowned out by a rotor’s THWACK, as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face to face in the wall-mounted jump seats, an INTENSELY ARMORED MILITARY UNIT: GANNON THE DESTROYER stuffs extra ammo in his Kevlar vest; GOAT reads a well-thumbed Bible. HERNANDEZ trims his goatee with a combat knife. THE KID, nervous 19-year-old, sits alone, keeping to himself until PORTMAN leans in.

dialogues.speaker: PORTMAN
dialogues.text: You know Kid, it’s funny. Couple weeks ago I tell Sarge I could use a little pussy. Next day, he brings you onto the team.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE, (0S)
dialogues.text: Portman! At the back of the chopper, SERGEANT ASHER MAHONIN emerge from the shadows. Making his presence felt.

dialogues.speaker: PORTMAN
dialogues.text: Sarge, come on. He looks like he just got his first pube last week. I mean, look at... From the shadows beside Sarge, a hard, saddened, and fami face leans forward: JOHN GRIMM, now 26.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Don't give me an excuse, Portman. No one here will miss you. Portman flips John off as Sarge pulls a vid-disc froma classified folder, inserts it into a bulkhead console.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Listen up...! A fuzzy IMAGE appears: Carmack's terrified transmission.

dialogues.speaker: CARMACK, (ON VIDEO)
dialogues.text: -- request immediate instructions to override protocol and shut down the Wormhole! My lab is sealed off from the general population, we have a Level Five Emergency... The transmission reverts to STATIC.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: That came in twenty minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna forward the code to shut down the Wormhole?

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: And strand a bunch of UAC personnel halfway across the universe? We neutralize the threat and bring out Carmack‘s team. John’s staring at the SNOW on the monitor. Softly:

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Grimm/Labs?

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Only way in. Sarge squeezes John’s shoulder, then moves down the aisle addressing his squad: SARGE (cont'd) Alright. You know the drill. The Kid (legal name STEPHEN DANTALIAN) grabs a pair of HANDHELD SEMI-AUTOMATICS. We HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: WEAPON ID
dialogues.text: UAC Special Ops clearance verified. Handle Identification: The Kid. Destroyer -- a humble man trapped inside the body of a wo wrecker -- feeds armor-piercing bullets into a gargantuan chain-gun. Slings an extra ammo chain on his broad should WEAPON ID (cont'd) UAC Special Ops clearance verified. Handle Identification: Destroyer. Goat, the oldest and most seasoned, sets down his Bible, a knee brace on a leathery leg, grabs an old-school shotg modified to read his palm sworl. WEAPON ID (cont'd) UAC Special Ops clearance verified. Handle Identification: Goat. Portman grips his PLASMA RIFLE, hefts its mass in his arm Makes him feel tougher. WEAPON ID (cont'd) UAC Special Ops clearance verified. Handle Identification: Portman. Hernandez lights a cigarette with one hand, grabs his Au Pistol with the other. Keeps twirling the pistol, as: WEAPON ID (cont'd) UAC Special Ops clearance verified. Handle Identification: Hernandez. (again) UAC Special Ops clearance verified. Handle Identification: Hernandez. (again) UAC Special Ops clearance verified. Handle Identification: Hernandez.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: I love the way this weapon says my name. If this weapon had a pair of lips and set of tits, I'd marry it. They pass around a roll of MASKING TAPE and a PEN, and scribble their blood types on the bottom of their boots. roll comes along to John, the only team member who hasn't “logged in.” He is silent for a moment, pensive.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: How long’s it been? Sarge’s appeared again above John.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Ten years...

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Sam still there? (John nods) You up for this?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: I don’t know if I can go back down there, Sarge. John habitually, contemplatively runs his finger along an scar on his forehead as the helicopter begins its descent

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: So, stay with the chopper. (then) But sooner or later, you're gonna have to face your demons. John grips his weapon, steels himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: UAC Special Ops clearance verified. Handle Identification: Reaper. In the distance, a large field is lit up like a football stadium in the middle absolutely nowhere. It’s perimeter twenty foot wall topped with concertina wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper has landed. A couple hundred EMPLOYEES are li up to be led onto buses parked in the immense empty field where the hell did all these people come from? They look as though they haven't seen daylight in months: pale, out of shape, disoriented. Carry a few quickly gathered possessions in the frigid pre-dawn darkness. The employees watch with mild disinterest as the heavily arme squad disembarks from the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: PORTMAN
dialogues.text: I thought the shit was going down on Olduvai?

dialogues.speaker: GOAT
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: PORTMAN
dialogues.text: So, why’re these guys leaving?

dialogues.speaker: GOAT
dialogues.text: Standard evac procedure for a Level Five Emergency. Sarge leads his Marines toward a massive stainless steel elevator that suddenly rises up out of a subterranean sha in the middle of what a moment ago was an empty field.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: UAC doesn’t want us tripping over a buncha civilians while we clean up another one a their goddam messes. The Kid stops to stare -- Holy shit -- as the big steel elevator doors open and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men hustle aboard. After a moment they begin their descent into the earth. A steel iris closes overhead, sealing the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: DESTROYER
dialogues.text: Hey, H. What happened with that girl Candace last night?

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Oh dude, she freaked when I tried to give her the Dirty Hernandez!

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Hernandez.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Right. Sorry. Sarge taps a full cartridge against his helmet.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Pray For War. The team -- including John -- ritually responds:

dialogues.speaker: SQUAD
dialogues.text: Pray For War. And BANG, the elevator dead drops, disappearing rapidly beneath us into the seemingly bottomless abyss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator door opens and the Marines fan out, into the empty lobby reception and security area of: The Louis & Mary Grimm Memorial Research Laboratory, a Division of Union Aerospace Corporation ... ++. according to the large sign above the entrance.

dialogues.speaker: GOAT
dialogues.text: Grimm Labs, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: We used to just call it “the hole.”  10. Beside the sign a pair of retouched, idealized photos of two Drs. Grimm and a dedication -- For their indispensable contribution to the study of our origins, as well _ as their warm, caring hearts.

dialogues.speaker: GOAT
dialogues.text: Good likeness?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: «.-eyeah... Long, tunnel like hallways spread out in every direction complicated signs indicating distant rooms and far flung research areas. The squad’s met by a senior facility Security Officer.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Any more transmissions from Olduvai?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Carmack’s lab’s been quiet. General population’s okay -- just nervous -- The Officer escorts the Squad into a white, antiseptic- looking tunnel. The sign above says simply “The Ark”.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: How many are up there, all together?

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Fifty-four, including the five staff still locked down inside Carmack’s classified lab.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You have a list of the personnel in that lab? Sarge looks back at John, unhappy with the interruption.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Not down here, but the Security team on Olduvai’ll have it. They reach a plain grey wall. The Guard punches an elabor code into a control panel. The wall seems to somehow soft

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Oh no, no, no. I don’t do nanowalls.  11.

dialogues.speaker: PORTMAN
dialogues.text: How can you not do nanowalls? That's like saying “I don’t do food.”

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: No. I do food, I don’t do nano-food, and I definitely don’t do nanowalls -- Sarge SHOVES Hernandez through the nanowall, into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tech (PINKY) greets the Team. He couldn't be more than but his face is ruined, features skewed in the wrong directions. He appears to be seated in an ELECTRIC WHEELCHAIR. A blanket covers his legs.

dialogues.speaker: PINKY
dialogues.text: Good morning Gentlemen, welcome to the Ark. My name is...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here? Pinky’s eyes narrow as he reads the stitching on John’s jacket: J. Grimm. Pinky gives a mirthless laugh.

dialogues.speaker: PINKY
dialogues.text: I work here. John stares at Pinky. Who slowly, torturously ... cracks half-frozen, twisted, mutilated, wholly sardonic smile --

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE - PINKY’S FACE Behind a shattered car window. 10 years younger. Unmarred Till a fist SMASHES it through the window again and again

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John worries his scar with a forefinger, stares Pinky dow

dialogues.speaker: PINKY
dialogues.text: Whoa, they gave you a gun. Did they give you a psychological test first?  12.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Now is not the time, Reaper.

dialogues.speaker: PINKY
dialogues.text: UAC was kind enough to offer me gainful employment. They felt bad after what you did.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: We got a job to do. Let’s do it. John's still staring at Pinky, it’s unnerving.

dialogues.speaker: PINKY
dialogues.text: Down here, please. Pinky anxiously gestures the Squad to the base of a mirro cylinder protected by TWO SENTRIES.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: We the first guys without a graduate degree to go through this doohickey? SILENCE. Hernandez puffs on his cig.

dialogues.speaker: DESTROYER
dialogues.text: Ever notice how things get diverse the minute some shit hits the fan? On the ring-shaped platform above the cylinder Pinky punc data into various computer terminals around the ring.

dialogues.speaker: PHIL
dialogues.text: Actually we’ve transported thousands; scientists, technicians, construction teams ...janitors.

dialogues.speaker: PORTMAN
dialogues.text: These names, what‘re all these names? He’s referring to a translucent plaque. The names of a sc of men and women are engraved in a sort of scroll.

dialogues.speaker: PINKY
dialogues.text: Ah. That’s the Honor Roll of folks who didn’t make it through intact. But that was before we perfected the crystalline structure. (which reminds him) Extinguish all smoking materials before entering the containment area. Just one spark or cinder, and --  13.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: (stubbing out his cig) Oh, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team now stands in a circle around the inner rim of t cylinder, eyes wide to a man. They are all staring at: A DROP of LIQUID floating in the cylinder’s center. Perfe compact, simple. Light and space bend and twist around th

dialogues.speaker: PINKY
dialogues.text: Not what you expected? Destroyer shakes his head. The sensitive soul inside the built-up body is incredulous -- moved -- overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: DESTROYER
dialogues.text: All this time, picturing “the Ark”, I always assumed it was a -- ship ... I mean, a space-ship, but not ...

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: «es a metaphor? The other squad-members appear both scared and dubious.

dialogues.speaker: PINKY
dialogues.text: It’s nothing more nor less than a quantum portal through the space/time continuum, a wormhole, a sort of “cosmic shortcut” across galaxies ... Off the squad’s looks (ranging through incredulity, fear outright awe) Pinky pompously advances to the “droplet”. Pinky (cont'd) I‘ll go first. Watch how it’s done --

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Sorry. First man through should be shouldering a loaded weapon. Sarge seems to share a momentary look with Pinky, then co his gun and walks to the Wormhole. Instantly it expands t envelop his body in a glistening, globular shell.  14. And, in a split-second FLASH OF BLUE LIGHT, the Wormhole condenses back to its original size -- and Sarge is GONE.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. “WORMHOLE CHAMBER” (OLDUVAI) - A MOMENT LATER Sarge, John, the rest emerge from an identical “DROPLET” an area similar to -- the “Wormhole Chamber” we just left our home planet. As the team tries to shake off the debilitating sensation Pinky rolls through from the other side, seemingly unaffected.

dialogues.speaker: PINKY
dialogues.text: Dizziness and nausea are transitory -- we know of no long-term ill effects. There’s a large, vault-like locked door leading out of th chamber. Beside it a bank of READ-OUTS for changes in air pressure, temperature, presence of pollutants and/or contaminants. Sarge moves to it quickly.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Main facility appears to be uncontaminated. Pinky unclips a key hanging from a chain around his neck that, strangely, looks like only part of a key. Turns to Sarge.

dialogues.speaker: PINKY
dialogues.text: I'll be waiting here for you when you're ready to head back.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You better be. Sarge unclips a “part-key” from his own neck-chain. He an Pinky insert their keys into the door, the massive hydrau lock pins SMASH back, and the door slides open to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sprawling complex with clean lines, ambient MUSIC and h ceilings illuminated to mimic sunlight on a bright spring day. As the squad heads into the facility:

dialogues.speaker: PORTMAN
dialogues.text: Where the hell are we ..?  15. Indeed, they could be in the lobby of a Midwestern Marrio

dialogues.speaker: GOAT
dialogues.text: How about a couple million light years from home? Destroyer feels the leaves of a potted tree: fake.

dialogues.speaker: DESTROYER
dialogues.text: And about a half-mile below ground. The mood is anything but sunny. Agitated employees mill about, hoping to be allowed to get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST 1
dialogues.text: What's going on? Are there casualties in Dr. Carmack’s lab? A tall, thin and aggressive Scientist steps up to Sarge.

dialogues.speaker: SCIENTIST 2
dialogues.text: Have we been exposed to some contagion? I have a newborn, I -- An Olduvian Security Officer, HUENGS intervenes.

dialogues.speaker: HUENGS
dialogues.text: That’s what they’re here to find out Dr. Willits. Excuse me -- (offers his hand) Lt. Huengs. UAC security. Dr. Carmack shut down his lab at 03:37 this morning. They're on the move, anxious personnel watching as they p HUENGS (cont'd) After the initial transmission we tried raising him on the internal com system and on the optic data lines but received no response.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: You have surveillance cameras in there, any kind of monitoring or listening devices?

dialogues.speaker: HUENGS
dialogues.text: No sir. It’s a classified area. Our job is to keep people out, not watch what they’re doing inside.  16.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: I want all non-essential personnel secured in the Residential Zone and out of our way.

dialogues.speaker: HUENGS
dialogues.text: A lot of the staff is requesting permission to evacuate back through the wormhole. John searches the faces of the gathered personnel as the Squad’s led across the atrium.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: No. Let’s figure out what we're dealing with first, okay?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: You got a list of names of the personnel who're in Carmack’s lab?

dialogues.speaker: HUENGS
dialogues.text: Sure. It’s on Huengs’ clipboard. John grabs it, anxiously runs finger down the columns. HUENGS (cont'd) That's all the personnel we’ve got up here, their work assignments are listed beside their names. Behind him, HEARS: WOMAN’S VOICE Next page. It’s alphabetical. John turns. He -- and we -- see a pretty RESEARCHER.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: RESEARCHER
dialogues.text: “Hey.” That's it?

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: (smiles, relieved) You don't work in Carmack’s lab ..? The two look pleased to see each Obviously it’s been awhile. Before she can answer: other -- also embarrassed, awkward.  17.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: This is my sister. Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: (D’oh) Oh. Hello, very nice to meet you. Rudely interrupted, by an impatient:

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Good to see you again, Sam. “My how you've grown,” and all that crap --

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You too, Asher. Steroids?

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Free weights. And you can address me as “Sergeant Mahonin” now, Samantha.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: In which case you can address me as “Dr. Grimm,” Sergeant. Touche.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Right. I need you to go back to the Residential Zone with everyone else.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: Actually, no. I’m going into the lab with you --

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Hell you are.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: -- to download as much of the research material as I can in case the facility has to be sealed or permanently evacuated. Crisply, before Sarge can elaborate his objections: SAM (cont'd) It’s UAC procedure, and it’s my job.  18. They’ve reached the outer door to the “Classified Researc lab area. Two more UAC security guys are guarding the hig security door and entrance.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: We were told there are five inside.

dialogues.speaker: HUENGS
dialogues.text: Yeah. We got lucky, two hours later there would've been eighteen. Only Carmack’s Genetics Team was working. Behind the Guard is a triple-deadbolted steel seal that l like a submarine pressure door.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: What is this, an air-lock?

dialogues.speaker: HUENGS
dialogues.text: Rumor’s been, Carmack’s experimenting with Olduvian viruses...

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: That's all it is: a rumor. Viruses are alive. Olduvai is dead. We study fossils and minerals up here, skeletons, rocks, planetary geology. She pulls a “part-key” from her shirt. Unclips, hands it Sarge. He inserts both keys, and Lab Security inserts one

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: You have a key.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: I’m one of the eighteen who would have been inside two hours later. The heavy door swings open, and the group enters:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A claustrophobic stainless steel cube. Goat and Portman s up their portable LAPT (Laser Airborne Particulate Tester

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Haz-mats. Out of Destroyer’s duffel come a half-dozen form-fitting mat_suits resembling lizard skins. As the men pull them o  19.

dialogues.speaker: JOHN
dialogues.text: Sam, grab a suit.

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: You guys notice this airlock has no ultraviolet light or decon shower? It’s not used for biocontainment, because there is no --

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Maybe we're looking at a disgruntled employee with a big-ass gun? The Carmack group is into Advanced Weapons R&D up here, right? Also the Genetics Team and what else?

dialogues.speaker: SAM
dialogues.text: There are four research labs. Genetics, Weapons, Pharmacology and Archeological Spectrography.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: Archeological, what? Sarge accesses the inner door with his one key, opening t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pitch black. Sarge locks the door behind them.

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: Can we get some juice, goddammit? As gun-mounted light-beams sweep the darkness, we glimpse Computer servers; charts, maps tacked to walls; display c of archeological findings. But no scientists, dead or ali SARGE (cont'd) Look alert, ladies: we’re in-country now -- and this is a live patrol. All radios on Alpha, weapons off safety -- and don’t blink. John flicks on an overhead light. Somehow, illuminating t shadowy secret space only makes the atmosphere even creep Portman waves a wand-shaped Sample Probe while Goat follo consulting a spectrometer that registers real-time readin  20.

dialogues.speaker: GOAT
dialogues.text: Magnesium, chromium, lead ... All normal levels so far, Sarge -- As cheerful as the outer facility was designed, Carmack’s is strictly utilitarian, intentionally stripped of any de that might give a comforting sense of what goes on in her GOAT (cont'd) No evidence of airborne biological agents, infectious aerosols or contaminated micro droplets ... no TB, rubella, or streptococci ... Sam throws John a look: told you.

dialogues.speaker: HERNANDEZ
dialogues.text: But major pucker factor, huh?

dialogues.speaker: SARGE
dialogues.text: OK. Huddle up. The Team gathers around Sarge, who, via a handheld disc, projects a 3-D blueprint of Carmack’s lab into the center the floor: a maze of rooms and halls. SARGE (cont'd) We’1ll begin on the periphery, move in pincer-style, enclosing any potential threat. Gannon, Kid: sweep Zone One. Goat, Portman, Zone Two. Hernandez, you and me will take the Armory, make sure those weapons are secure. Reaper: you keep Big Sister safe. dialogues.text: Chromosome 24. Carmack DISSOLVES to a new IMAGE: blurry black and white, poorly framed from a fixed camera mount above. We see a naked arm, part of a male torso, lying prone in the “pit. The crude video is stamped SUBJECT: STAHLE, CURTIS. 003 h

dialogues.text: Gannon! Heartbroken, he dashes to his best friend's body, embraci the massive, ruined cadaver in repose, unashamedly sobbin John follows, Portman’s medical pouch slung on a shoulder

dialogues.text: Or what's left of it... As the three crunch across a battlefield of crystal shards, spent rounds and bodies:
